title: The Restless Art-History of Painters and Painting, 1760-1960
description:
The Restless Art: A History of Painters and Painting, 1760-1960
J. B. Lippincott | 1966 | English | 438 pages | PDF | 61.3 MB


Many books have been written about what "modern painting" is and about the painters who have been most important in its evolution. But this book is concerned with the quite different question of why painting has developed as it has: why "beauty," as an artistic objective, has been abandoned in favor of "reality." In a narrative that discloses an impressive understanding of history and the artistic process, Alan Gowans unfolds before the reader the gradual but profound revolution that has taken place in painting over the last two centuries
